H0.text: Filter salt water is the role of glaciers in the water cycle, as glaciers cover about 10 % of the total land area on Earth.

H1.text: Storing fresh water is the role of glaciers in the water cycle, as glaciers cover about 10% of Earth's total land area.

H2.text: Move liquid water is the role of glaciers in the water cycle, as glaciers cover about 10% of the total land area on Earth.

H3.text: Precipitate solid water is the role of glaciers in the water cycle, which cover about 10 % of the total land area on Earth.

A4.text: The Earth's ice caps, glaciers, and permanent snowpack store 24,064,000 km3 of water, which accounts for 68.7% of all fresh water on the planet.

A5.text: The ocean holds 97% of the total water on the planet; 78% of global precipitation occurs over the ocean, and it is the source of 86% of global evaporation.
